trans-unit.source: Transferring an Azure subscription | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Transferring an Azure subscription | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to transfer an Azure subscription to another user, and some Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about the process
trans-unit.target: How to transfer an Azure subscription to another user, and some Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about the process

trans-unit.source: Transferring an Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Transferring an Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Do you:
trans-unit.target: Do you:

trans-unit.source: Need to hand over billing ownership of your Azure subscription to someone else?
trans-unit.target: Need to hand over billing ownership of your Azure subscription to someone else?

trans-unit.source: Want to change the account used to sign up for Azure?
trans-unit.target: Want to change the account used to sign up for Azure?

trans-unit.source: Perhaps you used your Microsoft Account but meant to use your work or school account instead?
trans-unit.target: Perhaps you used your Microsoft Account but meant to use your work or school account instead?

trans-unit.source: Want to move your Azure subscription from one directory to another?
trans-unit.target: Want to move your Azure subscription from one directory to another?

trans-unit.source: Have Azure and Office 365 in different tenants and want to consolidate?
trans-unit.target: Have Azure and Office 365 in different tenants and want to consolidate?

trans-unit.source: If your account is in the US, you can now do this easily in the Microsoft Azure Account Center- for Pay-As-You-Go subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: If your account is in the US, you can now do this easily in the Microsoft Azure Account Center- for Pay-As-You-Go subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: We’ve added the ability to transfer your subscription to another user.
trans-unit.target: We’ve added the ability to transfer your subscription to another user.

trans-unit.source: In other words, you can now change the account admin on any Pay-As-You-Go subscription that you own.
trans-unit.target: In other words, you can now change the account admin on any Pay-As-You-Go subscription that you own.

trans-unit.source: How to transfer an Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: How to transfer an Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Sign in at <html></html>
trans-unit.target: Sign in at <html></html>

trans-unit.source: Select the subscription to transfer.
trans-unit.target: Select the subscription to transfer.

trans-unit.source: Click the Transfer Subscription option.
trans-unit.target: Click the Transfer Subscription option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure account subscriptions tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure account subscriptions tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to specify the recipient.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to specify the recipient.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Transfer Subscription dialog box</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Transfer Subscription dialog box</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The recipient will automatically get an email with a acceptance link.
trans-unit.target: The recipient will automatically get an email with a acceptance link.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subscription transfer email to recipient</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subscription transfer email to recipient</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The recipient clicks on the link and follows the instructions,
trans-unit.target: The recipient clicks on the link and follows the instructions,

trans-unit.source: including entering their payment information.
trans-unit.target: including entering their payment information.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>First subscription transfer web page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>First subscription transfer web page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Second subscription transfer web page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Second subscription transfer web page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Success!
trans-unit.target: Success!

trans-unit.source: The subscription is now transferred.
trans-unit.target: The subscription is now transferred.

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions (FAQ)
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions (FAQ)

trans-unit.source: Does a subscription transfer result in any service downtime?
trans-unit.target: Does a subscription transfer result in any service downtime?

trans-unit.source: There is no impact to the service.
trans-unit.target: There is no impact to the service.

trans-unit.source: This effectively cancels the
trans-unit.target: This effectively cancels the

trans-unit.source: subscription under the current Account Administrator and creates a
trans-unit.target: subscription under the current Account Administrator and creates a

trans-unit.source: new one under the recipient’s account, but associates the underlying
trans-unit.target: new one under the recipient’s account, but associates the underlying

trans-unit.source: Azure services with the new subscription.
trans-unit.target: Azure services with the new subscription.

trans-unit.source: The subscription ID
trans-unit.target: The subscription ID

trans-unit.source: remains the same.
trans-unit.target: remains the same.

trans-unit.source: **If I take over billing ownership of a subscription from another
trans-unit.target: **If I take over billing ownership of a subscription from another

trans-unit.source: organization, will they continue to have access to my resources?**
trans-unit.target: organization, will they continue to have access to my resources?**

trans-unit.source: If the subscription is transferred to another tenant, the users associated with the previous tenant will lose access to the subscription.
trans-unit.target: If the subscription is transferred to another tenant, the users associated with the previous tenant will lose access to the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Even if a user is not a Service Admin or Co-admin anymore, they might still have access to the subscription through other security mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: Even if a user is not a Service Admin or Co-admin anymore, they might still have access to the subscription through other security mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: These include:
trans-unit.target: These include:

trans-unit.source: Management certificates that grant the user admin rights to subscription resources.
trans-unit.target: Management certificates that grant the user admin rights to subscription resources.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Access keys for services like Storage.
trans-unit.target: Access keys for services like Storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Remote Access credentials for services like Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Remote Access credentials for services like Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: This is not a complete list.
trans-unit.target: This is not a complete list.

trans-unit.source: The recipient should consider updating any secrets associated with the service if they need to restrict access to their resources.
trans-unit.target: The recipient should consider updating any secrets associated with the service if they need to restrict access to their resources.

trans-unit.source: Most resources can be updated as follows:
trans-unit.target: Most resources can be updated as follows:

trans-unit.source: Go to the Azure portal: <link><linkText>*https://portal.azure.com*</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Go to the Azure portal: <link><linkText>*https://portal.azure.com*</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: **If I transfer the subscription in the middle of the billing cycle,
trans-unit.target: **If I transfer the subscription in the middle of the billing cycle,

trans-unit.source: does the recipient pay for the entire billing cycle?**
trans-unit.target: does the recipient pay for the entire billing cycle?**

trans-unit.source: The sender is responsible for payment for any usage that was reported up to the point that the transfer is completed.
trans-unit.target: The sender is responsible for payment for any usage that was reported up to the point that the transfer is completed.

trans-unit.source: The recipient is responsible for usage reported from the time of
trans-unit.target: The recipient is responsible for usage reported from the time of

trans-unit.source: transfer onwards.
trans-unit.target: transfer onwards.

trans-unit.source: There may be some usage that took place before transfer but was reported afterwards.
trans-unit.target: There may be some usage that took place before transfer but was reported afterwards.

trans-unit.source: This will be included in the recipient’s bill.
trans-unit.target: This will be included in the recipient’s bill.

trans-unit.source: Does the recipient have access to usage and billing history?
trans-unit.target: Does the recipient have access to usage and billing history?

trans-unit.source: At this time, the only information revealed to the recipient is the amount of the last bill (or the current balance, if the subscription was transferred before the first bill was generated).
trans-unit.target: At this time, the only information revealed to the recipient is the amount of the last bill (or the current balance, if the subscription was transferred before the first bill was generated).

trans-unit.source: The rest of the usage and billing history does not transfer with the subscription.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the usage and billing history does not transfer with the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Can the offer be changed during a transfer?
trans-unit.target: Can the offer be changed during a transfer?

trans-unit.source: The offer must remain the same.
trans-unit.target: The offer must remain the same.

trans-unit.source: To change your offer, you must <link><linkText>contact Support</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To change your offer, you must <link><linkText>contact Support</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: **Can I transfer a subscription to a user account in another
trans-unit.target: **Can I transfer a subscription to a user account in another

trans-unit.source: country?**
trans-unit.target: country?**

trans-unit.source: No, at this time this is not supported.
trans-unit.target: No, at this time this is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The recipient’s user account must be in the same country.
trans-unit.target: The recipient’s user account must be in the same country.

trans-unit.source: Can the recipient use a different payment mechanism?
trans-unit.target: Can the recipient use a different payment mechanism?

trans-unit.source: Yes, and in fact you can use this mechanism to change the payment method on your subscription from invoice to credit card.
trans-unit.target: Yes, and in fact you can use this mechanism to change the payment method on your subscription from invoice to credit card.

trans-unit.source: Just transfer to another account you own, and enter your credit card while receiving the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Just transfer to another account you own, and enter your credit card while receiving the subscription.

trans-unit.source: There are limitations here: now the subscription billing history is split across two accounts.
trans-unit.target: There are limitations here: now the subscription billing history is split across two accounts.

trans-unit.source: But the advantage is that you can do this without having to <link><linkText>contact Support</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: But the advantage is that you can do this without having to <link><linkText>contact Support</linkText><title></title></link>.
